title: Static Freight Management Marketing Site (4 pages)

requirements.summary: Implement a static 4-page marketing site with client-side routing (Home, About Us, Services, Contact Us) and no backend dependencies.
acceptanceCriteria: The site has 4 distinct routes/pages: Home, About Us, Services, Contact Us.
All pages render without backend dependencies and work as a static brochure site.
Navigation between pages works via a consistent header navigation on desktop and mobile.

file_operations.description: Ensure the frontend has a routing dependency (e.g., react-router-dom) and required build dependencies to support 4 distinct client-side routes.
Create the app shell with client-side routing for Home, About Us, Services, and Contact Us routes (static content only; no backend calls).
Create the Home page route component with static brochure content.
Create the About Us page route component with static brochure content.
Create the Services page route component with static brochure content.
Create the Contact Us page route component with static brochure content and a client-only form experience.

requirements.summary: Add a shared responsive layout (header/nav, main, footer) across all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Header includes the company name/logo area and links to Home, About Us, Services, Contact Us.
Footer appears on every page and includes at minimum: company name, a short tagline, and basic contact placeholders (phone/email/location).
Layout is responsive and readable on mobile, tablet, and desktop widths.

file_operations.description: Create a shared layout component (header with navigation + footer) used by all routes. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button) for consistent navigation actions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a responsive header navigation (desktop links + mobile menu) including company name/logo area. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Sheet/DropdownMenu/Button) for the mobile navigation pattern; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a footer displayed on every page with company name, tagline, and contact placeholders (phone/email/location).
Wire SiteLayout into the router so all four pages share the same header/footer and responsive container behavior.

requirements.summary: Build the Home page with hero, credibility highlights, and CTAs linking to Services and Contact Us.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page includes a hero with a headline, subheadline, and primary CTA button linking to Contact Us.
Home page includes 3–6 credibility highlight items (e.g., on-time delivery, global coverage, tracking, customs expertise) presented as cards or a grid.
Home page includes a brief services preview section linking to the Services page.

file_operations.description: Implement hero section (with image + headline/subheadline + primary CTA to Contact), credibility highlights grid (3–6 items), and a services preview section linking to Services. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button) for highlights and CTAs; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a reusable services preview grid used on Home to link into the Services page. Use shadcn-ui Card styling for preview items; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Build the About Us page with overview sections and a simple timeline or stats strip.
acceptanceCriteria: About Us page includes at least: Company Overview, Mission & Values, and Why Choose Us sections.
About Us page includes either a timeline component (3–5 milestones) or a stats strip (e.g., years in business, shipments handled, countries served).

file_operations.description: Implement Company Overview, Mission & Values, and Why Choose Us sections plus a stats strip or timeline (3–5 items). Use shadcn-ui Card/Separator components for clean section structure; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a simple stats strip component (e.g., years in business, shipments handled, countries served) to display on About. Use shadcn-ui Card or similar surface styles; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Build the Services page showcasing many freight-related services organized into categories with cards and a Contact CTA.
acceptanceCriteria: Services page includes multiple categories (e.g., Air Freight, Ocean Freight, Road/Trucking, Rail, Customs Brokerage, Warehousing, Last-mile, Project Cargo, Freight Insurance, Supply Chain Consulting).
Each service is displayed as a card/list item with a title and 1–3 sentence description.
Services page provides a CTA area linking to Contact Us for quotes/consultations.

file_operations.description: Implement categorized service sections and render each service as a card/list item with title + short description, plus a CTA area linking to Contact. Use shadcn-ui Card and Button for service items and CTA; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable category section component to render a category title and a responsive grid of service cards. Use shadcn-ui Card for consistent service presentation; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Create a static Contact page with a client-side validated form and non-sending submission success state plus visible contact details.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact form includes: Name, Email, Phone (optional), Service Interested In (select), Message.
Client-side validation: required fields and valid email format; show inline error messages.
On submit, the app shows a success state (no external email/service integration).
Page includes visible contact details (email, phone, office address placeholders) and business hours placeholders.

file_operations.description: Implement a static contact form with client-side validation and a success message on submit (no sending/storing). Show visible contact details and business hours placeholders. Use shadcn-ui form inputs (Input, Textarea, Select) and Alert for success/error presentation; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add lightweight client-side validation helpers (required fields + email format) for the Contact form; keep logic frontend-only and static.

Create a contact details card (email/phone/address/hours placeholders) to display alongside the form. Use shadcn-ui Card for consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent logistics-appropriate theme (non-default blue/purple) with consistent typography, spacing, and component styling.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent design system is evident across pages (same button styles, card styles, headings, spacing scale).
Color palette is not the default blue/purple; use a distinct logistics-appropriate theme (e.g., charcoal + safety orange accents or deep green + sand accents).
All pages look visually consistent and polished with Tailwind styling.

file_operations.description: Create global styles and CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn theme tokens; set a logistics palette (e.g., charcoal base with safety-orange accents) and consistent typography/spacing defaults.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions (if needed) to support the chosen logistics palette and consistent container/typography utilities without introducing a default blue/purple look.

Apply consistent layout spacing, max-width container rules, and shared typographic styles across pages using Tailwind utility classes and shadcn-ui surfaces; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add generated static images (hero, logos, service icons) under public assets and render them in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
Hero image and logo appear on the site without being served through the backend.
Images are optimized for web display (appropriate dimensions and file types).

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero banner image asset at the required path for direct static serving.
Add the generated light logo image asset at the required path for direct static serving.
Add the generated dark logo image asset at the required path for direct static serving.
Add the generated service icon sheet asset at the required path for direct static serving.

Render the appropriate logo variant in the header (light/dark as needed) by referencing frontend/public/assets/generated/freight-logo-light.dim_512x512.png and/or frontend/public/assets/generated/freight-logo-dark.dim_512x512.png.
Render the hero banner image by referencing frontend/public/assets/generated/freight-hero.dim_1920x800.png, ensuring it displays well responsively without backend involvement.

Reference frontend/public/assets/generated/freight-service-icons.dim_1024x1024.png to visually support service categories (e.g., via cropped usage or mapped icons), keeping all assets static and frontend-served.
